channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: 'Monumental betrayal' - cheapest World Cup final ticket to cost £3,119
item.description: Fans' group Football Supporters Europe says it is "astonished" by Fifa's "extortionate" pricing strategy for World Cup tickets.

item.title: Is Salah right to feel 'thrown under the bus'?
item.description: BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty takes a look at whether the Liverpool striker's claim is justified.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v England Gaming star Daniel 'Stingray' Ray
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on England Gaming star Daniel 'Stingray' Ray - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Liverpool, Man City and Spurs in running for Semenyo
item.description: Antoine Semenyo's future looks set to dominate the forthcoming transfer window with rival clubs circling.

item.title: 'No-one downing tools' - Alonso's stay of execution despite loss to Man City
item.description: The deafening jeers that greeted former Barcelona boss Pep Guardiola before kick-off turned into away-fan cheers thanks to Manchester City's fine victory.

item.title: Can 'magic moment' Madueke find consistency for Arsenal?
item.description: Noni Madueke might reflect on the Champions League win at Club Brugge as a landmark night in his Arsenal career - but can he find consistency?

item.title: Emery's perseverance & belief key to Villa resurgence
item.description: Just 11 weeks ago Aston Villa were winless and third bottom of the Premier League. Now they are in the conversation for the title.

item.title: Was McTominay unlucky to not get Spoty nomination?
item.description: Some in Scotland are unhappy after Scott McTominay missed out on shortlist for the 2025 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.

item.title: Madueke scores twice in Arsenal victory over Club Brugge
item.description: Noni Madueke scores twice and Gabriel Martinelli scores a third for Arsenal to beat Club Brugge 3-0 and maintain their Champions League winning streak.

item.title: Man City beat Real Madrid to pile pressure on Alonso
item.description: Goals from Nico O'Reilly and Erling Haaland give Manchester City a 2-1 victory over Real Madrid at the Bernabeu, to pile pressure on Madrid manager Xabi Alonso.

item.title: Leverkusen score late equaliser to deny Newcastle win
item.description: Newcastle United concede another painful late goal as Alex Grimaldo rescues a dramatic Champions League point for Bayer Leverkusen.

item.title: Szoboszlai scores late penalty as Liverpool beat Inter
item.description: Dominik Szoboszlai scores a late penalty as Liverpool claim a 1-0 away win over Inter Milan 1-0 in the Champions League.

item.title: Kudus and Simons score as Tottenham beat Slavia Prague
item.description: Mohammed Kudus and Xavi Simons both score from the penalty spot for Tottenham Hotspur in a 3-0 win against Slavia Prague.

item.title: Macclesfield FC 'saved his life' - how football club owner overcame addiction
item.description: Football club owner Rob Smethurst discusses how Macclesfield FC contributed to overcoming a personal struggle with addiction.

item.title: Which three Arsenal assets to pick v Wolves? FPL team of week
item.description: A home match for Arsenal against dismal Wolves is the key fixture for FPL managers to target this week - it's just a case of deciding which three Gunners to select.

item.title: West Ham watch in-form Clayton - Thursday's gossip
item.description: West Ham are watching Clayton, Roma open negotiations over Joshua Zirkzee, Sunderland bid for Matteo Guendouzi, plus more.

item.title: World Cup ticket ballot opens - here's all you need to know
item.description: The main ticket ballot for next summer's World Cup in North America opens on Thursday with 'record high' prices for fans.

item.title: Vardy is first English Serie A player of the month
item.description: Cremonese striker Jamie Vardy is the Serie A player of the month for November, becoming the first English player to win the award.

item.title: 'A stunning team performance' as Chelsea share goals around against Roma
item.description: Five players wrote their names on the scoresheet as Chelsea saw off Roma in the Women's Champions League.

item.title: 'You have to stand up and be counted' - history repeats itself for Newcastle
item.description: Newcastle United show immense spirit to come from behind against Bayer Leverkusen only to concede another late goal.

item.title: Salah a target for Saudi clubs, says league chief
item.description: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah is a target for clubs in the Saudi Pro League, confirms chief executive Omar Mugharbel.

item.title: 'Northerners are tougher than southerners!' - Tottenham confessions
item.description: Tottenham players including Bethany England, Kit Graham, Jessica Naz and Lena Gunning-Williams share their confessions, including unpopular opinions and their team-mate icks.

item.title: 'Remarkable' Madueke goal puts Arsenal ahead against Club Brugge
item.description: Noni Madueke scores a "remarkable" goal to give Arsenal the lead against Club Brugge in the Champions League.

item.title: Benfica boost knockout play-off chances with win over Napoli
item.description: Jose Mourinho's Benfica pick up their second victory in the league phase of the Champions League with a 2-0 win over Antonio Conte's Napoli.

item.title: Atalanta fight back to dent Chelsea Champions League hopes
item.description: Chelsea's hopes of qualifying automatically for the Champions League knockouts were dealt a blow as Atalanta come from 1-0 down to win in Bergamo.

item.title: Juventus score twice in five second-half minutes to sink Pafos
item.description: Second-half goals from Weston McKennie and Jonathan David help Juventus see off a determined Pafos to secure at 2-0 Champions League win in Turin.

item.title: 'Magic' Martinelli scores stunning third for Arsenal
item.description: Gabriel Martinelli becomes the first Arsenal player to score in five Champions League games in a row after netting a stunning third goal for the Gunners against Club Brugge.

item.title: Madueke first goal was a magic moment - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says that Noni Madueke's first goal was "unbelievable" in their 3-0 defeat against Club Brugge.

item.title: O'Reilly equalises for Man City against Real Madrid
item.description: Manchester City's Nico O'Reilly fires home from close range against Real Madrid to make it 1-1 in their Champions League match at the Bernabeu.

item.title: Ajax come from behind twice to beat Qarabag in six-goal thriller
item.description: Ajax pick up their first win of their Champions League campaign as they come from behind twice to defeat Qarabag in Azerbaijan.

item.title: How Real Madrid struggled against 'exceptional' Doku and O'Reilly
item.description: Champions League pundit Leon Osman looks at how Real Madrid were unable to cope with Manchester City's left-hand side of Jeremy Doku and Nico O'Reilly.

item.title: Emery wants to find 'solution' for loanee Elliott
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says he wants to "get a solution" for on-loan Harvey Elliott, who will "not definitely" be joining the club on a permanent basis.

item.title: Messi to unveil 70ft statue of himself on 'GOAT' tour
item.description: Lionel Messi is heading to India to unveil a 70ft statue of himself as part of a three-day 'GOAT Tour'.

item.title: Man Utd humbled by Lyon - but key lessons learned
item.description: Manchester United were given a demonstration of what it takes to be Europe's best on Wednesday night - but Marc Skinner hopes his side can learn from it.

item.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
item.description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

item.title: BBC to show Scotland's first World Cup game since 1998
item.description: The BBC will broadcast Scotland's first World Cup match since 1998, when they take on Haiti on 14 June, plus their final group match against Brazil and England's group match against Ghana.

item.title: Matos set to be joined by backroom staff at Swansea
item.description: Vitor Matos says his backroom team from former club Maritimo are on the brink of joining him at Swansea City.

item.title: Alonso's Real Madrid future uncertain after Man City defeat - analysis
item.description: Champions League pundit Rory Smith looks at the future of Real Madrid's Xabi Alonso following their 2-1 defeat to Manchester City in the Champions League, which leaves the Spanish club on a run of two wins from their last eight games.

item.title: Madueke and Martinelli the 'magic men' for Arsenal in Brugge
item.description: Champions League pundits Leon Osman and Chris Sutton analyse the performance of "magic men" Noni Madueke's and Gabriel Martinelli in Arsenal's 3-0 victory over Club Brugge.

item.title: Kounde scores twice as Barcelona fight back to beat Frankfurt
item.description: Defender Jules Kounde scores twice in three minutes to help Barcelona come from a goal down to beat Eintracht Frankfurt 2-1.

item.title: 17-year-old Karl scores again for Bayern in comeback win
item.description: Bayern Munich come from behind after conceding an own goal to beat Sporting CP 3-1, with teenageer Lennart Karl becoming the first the youngest player in UEFA Champions League history to score in three consecutive matches in the competition.

item.title: Atletico Madrid claim entertaining win over PSV
item.description: Atletico Madrid hold on to claim a narrow win over PSV in an entertaining Champions League game at Philips Stadion.

item.title: Cardiff proving they will not be bullied - Wintle
item.description: Cardiff City are proving they will not be "bullied" by League One's physically-imposing teams, says Ryan Wintle.

item.title: Villa agree £10.5m deal for teenage winger Alysson
item.description: Teenage winger Alysson is expected to move to Villa Park from Gremio for an initial fee of £8.7m, rising to £10.5m, in January.

item.title: England to play Uruguay and Japan in March
item.description: England will take on Uruguay and Japan at Wembley in March in their final two games before Thomas Tuchel names his 2026 World Cup squad.

item.title: BBC or ITV? Inside how World Cup broadcast picks are made
item.description: We now know the broadcast schedule for the 2026 World Cup, but how do BBC and ITV decide who shows which matches?

item.title: Who is Arsenal's teenage debutant Salmon?
item.description: Arsenal bring 16-year-old Marli Salmon on as a substitute against Club Brugge in the Champions League, but who is he?

item.title: Egypt want World Cup 'Pride Match' plans cancelled
item.description: The organisation behind the LGBTQ+ "Pride Match" at the 2026 World Cup say they intend to push forward with their plans despite one of the teams involved objecting to Fifa.

item.title: Son, Simons and mini Spurs revival lift Frank's spirits
item.description: Son Heung-min's emotional return sets the tone for another significant step forward for Spurs and head coach Thomas Frank, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Why have Nancy's Celtic tactics board & green shoes caused consternation?
item.description: Why have a mini tactics board and a pair of trainers caused a stir within Scottish football this week?

item.title: 'A sense of panic' - what's going on in Turkish football?
item.description: A wide-ranging investigation into illegal gambling involving figures in Turkish football is underway with hundreds of players, club owners and referees under scrutiny, BBC Sport looks at what's going on.

item.title: Fifa accused of breaching own rules with Trump award
item.description: Gianni Infantino is accused of breaking Fifa rules by a campaign group after giving United States President Donald Trump a peace prize.

item.title: Pogba invests in Saudi Arabian camel racing team
item.description: France's World Cup winner Paul Pogba is moving into the sport of camel racing after investing in Saudi Arabia-based team Al Haboob.

item.title: All you need to know about Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa provides all the information on the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations ahead of the 35th edition of the continent's biggest sporting event.

item.title: Are Man Utd turning the tide or is a 'bad result just around corner'?
item.description: Manchester United moved into the Premier League top six with their biggest win of the season - but they still have to prove the doubters wrong.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Everyone follows fashion' - is Premier League better now than 20 years ago?
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at what has changed in the Premier League in the past couple of decades and whether it is for the better, from a manager's perspective.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: How did Littler get Man Utd away tickets - and why has it sparked debate?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore how Luke Littler got Manchester United away tickets against Wolves on Monday evening.

item.title: Why is there a 15:30 Champions League match?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why there is a 15:30 GMT kick-off in the Champions League on Tuesday

item.title: What is an 'Olimpico' goal in football?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the definition of and origins behind the 'Olimpico' goal

item.title: 'It was handball, wasn't it?' - why Rutter goal against West Ham stood
item.description: Georginio Rutter's late equaliser in Brighton's 1-1 draw with West Ham on Sunday was allowed to stand despite handball claims. BBC Sport looks at the rules to explain why.

item.title: When will England & Scotland find out World Cup venues?
item.description: England and Scotland will discover when and where they will play their World Cup 2026 group stage matches during a draw on Saturday.

item.title: Unlucky own goal helps Gladbach beat Mainz
item.description: Watch highlights, as the Bundesliga's bottom side Mainz 05 suffer a narrow defeat to Borussia Monchengladbach.

item.title: Real's Courtois asks fans to stop abuse of players
item.description: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois urges supporters to show players more "respect" after team-mate Vinicius Jr is once again the target of abuse by fans.

item.title: Real Madrid's Alexander-Arnold out for two months
item.description: England defender Trent Alexander‑Arnold will be out for about two months after sustaining a thigh injury during Real Madrid's win over Athletic Club.

item.title: Nice condemn fans over 'unacceptable' player confrontation
item.description: Nice condemn a group of fans in the "strongest possible terms" after cplayers and staff were physically confronted on their return home following Sunday's 3-1 defeat at Lorient.

item.title: Bayern in advanced talks to extend Upamecano deal
item.description: Bayern Munich expect Dayot Upamecano to sign a new contract, with the defender in advanced talks over committing his future to the club.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
